fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37665].
  {panel}

As an administrator of a JIRA system, I would like to be able to provide a custom field type similar to the existing "Select List (cascading)" but for which it is possible for the user to select multiple values.

The "Select List (cascading)" field's description is "Choose multiple values from two select lists", so I was surprised to find that it is only possible to select one (pair) value.

I expected that it would behave in a similar manner to "Select List (multiple choice)" (given that the description is: "Choose multiple values in a select list"), with it being possible to re-use the paired-select-lists multiple times on a given issue, selecting and removing options (or rather option pairs) 

E.g. Favourite Soccer Teams:
[Leagues][v] > [Teams][v]
Selected:
- English Premier League > Arsenal (x)
- English Premier League > Liverpool (x)
- Spanish La Liga > Real Madrid (x)

The user experience when viewing and removing could, for instance, have been similar to the 'Labels' custom field.

It seems this is not currently supported, so I would like to request this feature.
fields.summary: Multiple selections in Cascading Select List

h5. Steps to reproduce

# Create 2 issue type schemes.
#* SchemeA for ProjectA
#* SchemeB for ProjectB
# Set the default issue type
#* New Feature for ProjectA
#* Improvement for ProjectB
# Create new issue. It will show ProjectA with New Feature issue type.
# Switch to ProjectB, issue type is still New Feature.

h5. Expected Behavior
It will show ProjectB with Improvement issue type.

h5. Requirements
The issue types for both SchemeA and SchemeB are identical
fields.summary: Refresh the configured Default Issue Type for each Issue Type Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37655].
  {panel}

h4. Symptoms

Creating a new issue out of Admin mode pops up a Create Issue window, where unfilled required fields will be notified:
!createpopup.png|thumbnail!

The point is, other field values will be remained if already filled, including Epic Link, Sprint, and Linked Issues:
!createremain.png|thumbnail!

Creating a new issue from Admin mode (e.g. from Administration -> Issues) will not pop up a Create Issue window, instead the process will go through 2 phases:
!createadmin.png|thumbnail!

!createerror.png|thumbnail!

The point is, if required fields are unfilled (and the page refreshes), then specific fields will lose their filled value or even go missing. In the following screenshot, Epic Link, Sprint, and Linked Issues are losing their filled value (automatically cleared) while Remaining Estimate is missing:
!createcleared.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workarounds
* Make sure required fields are filled before clicking on Create to create a new issue
* Use the Create Issue pop-up window out of Admin mode
fields.summary: Field values automatically cleared due to unfilled required fields when creating issues from Admin mode

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37649].
  {panel}

The use of Roles at a project level is quite useful as a project administrator can set the values there, without the need to ask a system administrator to define groups.

For this reason, it would be nice to see the inclusion of Roles e.g. 
a Role = union of {users, groups, Roles}.

On a recent project with about a 100 users the project administrator, set up roles to represent the different interest groups.  We were then forced with 2 options: 
[1] change the notification scheme to include all the Role types or
[2] repeat all the users in each of the different Roles into the [user] role which was used in the notification scheme. e.g. we wanted the User role to be the union of all the Roles in the project.
fields.summary: Roles be the union of users, groups and/or roles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37629].
  {panel}

This is not likely limited to JIRA.  However, there is no Atlassian SDK project in which users have permission to open tickets.

When developing plugins using the SDK, if the standalone server is started using '--server localhost', the service should bind to localhost.  It should not be accessible from the network.  Regardless of how secure you feel Atlassian's products may be, this is a security risk when developing custom modules.

{code}
>>> atlas-run-standalone --server localhost --product jira
...
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] Tomcat 7.x started on port [2990]
[INFO] jira started successfully in 73s at http://localhost:2990/jira
[INFO] Type Ctrl-D to shutdown gracefully
[INFO] Type Ctrl-C to exit
{code}

Then, from another terminal:
{code}
>>> netstat -anutp |grep LISTEN
...
tcp6    0    0 :::8009     :::*     LISTEN      32222/java
tcp6    0    0 :::2990     :::*     LISTEN      32222/java
tcp6    0    0 :::35730    :::*     LISTEN      32222/java
{code}

None of these sockets should, at this point, be bound to all interfaces.

Furthermore, users on other hosts can, at this point, connect to the listening instance using the default admin/admin credentials.

Many users do not know how to; do not know that they need to; or do not have permission to restrict access to these ports using firewall rules.
fields.summary: development standalone server should bind to localhost

h4. SDK provides Issue in relevantParams
{noformat}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  Keys for 'relevantParams'
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  ====================KEY: null
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  ====================KEY: issue
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  ====================KEY: requireProjectIds
{noformat}

h4. Standalone JIRA does not

{noformat}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  Keys for 'relevantParams'
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  ====================KEY: null
{noformat}
---


A custom field may be sensitive to the project context of the issue currently being validated. For instance I would like to get the list a actors associated with a project role of the project referenced by the issue being validated. The CustomFieldType interface method "public void validateFromParams(CustomFieldParams relevantParams, ErrorCollection errorCollectionToAddTo, FieldConfig config)" does not pass the Issue reference so I can't determine the projectId. I have tried different hacks to get access to the current issue (i.e. getting the "EditIssue" action from the Action context. The problem here is that if you edit another issue in another browser tab of the same browser, the second issue will overwrite the "Edit Issue" Action before the first Issue is validated.
If system field types get an Issue reference in the validation method why don't custom field types.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37602].
  {panel}

As of JIRA 6.1, the Java API was modified to deprecate the [AttachmentUtils|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/6.1/com/atlassian/jira/util/AttachmentUtils.html] class, replacing it with the [AttachmentManager|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/6.1/com/atlassian/jira/issue/AttachmentManager.html] service.  However, the file-handling methods of AttachmentUtils have been moved to the new [AttachmentStore|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/6.1/com/atlassian/jira/issue/attachment/AttachmentStore.html] service, which is not exported for use by v2 plugins.

This means that any plugin attempting to access the actual Attachment files (e.g. copying them to another issue) must be implemented as a v1 plugin, which is often [less desirable|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Differences+between+Plugins1+and+Plugins2].

Please update the implementation to export the AttachmentStore service for use by v2 plugins.

(Note: I'm aware that v2 plugins can create their own instance of [DefaultAttachmentStore|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/6.1/com/atlassian/jira/issue/attachment/DefaultAttachmentStore.html], and this can be a short-term workaround.  However, this is not feasible for long-term maintainability, as it requires re-evaluating the implementation specifics with every new release.)
fields.summary: Provide AttachmentStore service to v2 plugins

Hi,

We need to figure out the way to make edit-ability of JIRA fields based on field as well as tab under view/edit screen.

Currently we are facing the problem of inline editing,as after making a field read-only through behavioral plugin even then through inline editing in JIRA the very field can be edited.So we need the way to disable this inline editing.

With Regards,
Abhishek Sharma.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37581].
  {panel}

In our instance of Jira we are using the security level field as the basis of our security scheme and we are able to control who sees security issues at various levels.

However, when a reporter creates a security issue, the summary and description of the issue are passed back to the reporter and potential watchers in a clear text email. Subsequent changes to the issue are also reported in emails. A diligent attacker could monitor such emails.

It would be good if there was a simple way to control the content of emails sent when the security level is set.

Our current workaround is to use an alternate notification system that allows greater control, but a simpler built-in solution would benefit all users.
fields.summary: Jira sends clear text emails with details even when an issue has a non-public issue security scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37574].
  {panel}

*Problem*
After fully restoring a fresh OnDemand backup into a fresh JIRA 6.2.1 instance, no user is able to log into the application.

*Expected results*
JIRA should allow all users to successfully log into the application

*Actual Results*
All users (including sysadmin) get a "You do not have a permission to log in. If you think this is incorrect, please contact your JIRA administrators." error message.
atlassian-jira.security.log displays the following
{noformat}
2014-03-20 13:46:56,834 http-bio-8080-exec-1 anonymous 826x106x1 1p3qqqo 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login The user 'sysadmin' is NOT AUTHORIZED to perform to login for this request
2014-03-20 13:46:56,834 http-bio-8080-exec-1 anonymous 826x106x1 1p3qqqo 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login login : 'sysadmin' tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found. Deleting remember me cookie.
{noformat}
No error is logged into catalina.out (or atlassian.jira.log).

Everything seems correct in the database side (cwd_user/app_user/cwd_membership/cwd_directory tables)

*Workaround*
- Import OnDemand backup using JIRA 6.2
- Shutdown the instance
- Start JIRA 6.2.1 pointing to the JIRA 6.2 database
JIRA will upgrade the 6.2 database and you can use your JIRA 6.2.1 successfully
fields.summary: Unable to log in after JIRA OnDemand restore into JIRA Standalone

fields.description:
I have jira-system-administrators access (can do everything for JIRA including installation of add-ons) but I cannot use the field "issuelinks" in my filters.

Sample

project = abc and issuetype = issue and issuelinks is empty

Could you please help me figure out why this is not permitted? How can I get access?

I can however, display this field and is shown as Links.
fields.summary: Unable to use field "issuelinks"
Browse Project AJAX Tab loading broken for old-style url
Could Jira provide a custom field type like a comment field?

Following along *The Complete Remote Link* example:

https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+API+for+Remote+Issue+Links#JIRARESTAPIforRemoteIssueLinks-TheCompleteRemoteLink

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37548].
  {panel}

Referring to [Connecting JIRA to SQL Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008] documentation. We asked users to set the following while setting up the database:
* SET NOCOUNT OFF
* SET READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT ON

Some users may have missed these important requirement and causes problems on their instances. Wouldn't it be great if JIRA could check these settings when SQL Server is selected during Database Setup?

And when we managed to run the check, I believe we should be able to alter the database as well.
fields.summary: Checks and Automatically Update to the Required Setting when Connecting JIRA to SQL Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37538].
  {panel}

JIRA is very sensitive to database encoding/collation which results in errors during upgrade as well as normal application functioning if the collation specified is not correct.

It would be easier for JIRA administrators if JIRA would warn of improper collation during
# Installation
# Upgrade
# Startup

The following are the SQL queries for checking database collation for the different supported databases:

h3.Oracle: How to check database encoding for Oracle database
{code}SQL> SELECT * FROM NLS_DATABASE_PARAMETERS WHERE PARAMETER='NLS_CHARACTERSET';

PARAMETER        |   VALUE
----------------------------------------------------------------------
NLS_CHARACTERSET | AL32UTF8
{code}

h3.MySQL: How to check database collation for MySQL database
{code}mysql> SELECT * FROM information_schema.SCHEMATA S where SCHEMA_NAME = "jiradb";
+--------------+-------------+----------------------------+------------------------+----------+
| CATALOG_NAME | SCHEMA_NAME | DEFAULT_CHARACTER_SET_NAME | DEFAULT_COLLATION_NAME | SQL_PATH |
+--------------+-------------+----------------------------+------------------------+----------+
| def          | jiradb      | utf8                       | utf8_bin               | NULL     |
+--------------+-------------+----------------------------+------------------------+----------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)
{code}

h3.PostgreSQL: How to check database collation for PostgreSQL database
{code}psql=# SELECT datname, pg_encoding_to_char(encoding), datcollate, datctype FROM pg_database WHERE datname = 'jiradb';
 datname | pg_encoding_to_char | datcollate  |  datctype
---------+---------------------+-------------+-------------
 jiradb  | UTF8                | en_AU.UTF-8 | en_AU.UTF-8
{code}

h3.Microsoft SQL Server: How to check database collation for MS SQL database
{code}SELECT name, collation_name FROM sys.databases WHERE name='jiradb';
+--------------+----------------------------------+
| name         | collation_name                   |
+--------------+----------------------------------+
| jiradb       | SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI   | 
+--------------+----------------------------------+
{code}
fields.summary: Warn about unsupported database encoding/collation during installation, upgrade and startup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37537].
  {panel}

Vitaliy, an add-on vendor, was getting 401 responses when attempting to POST to the /rest/api/2/issue REST API endpoint. 401 indicates that authentication is required but has not been provided. However, he eventually discovered that his query content needed to change.

The red herring wasted his time and ours.

For more info see:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/atlassian-connect-dev/BauvsLkj9Ng/WnlxiwE11I8J
fields.summary: 401 response from /rest/api/2/issue unrelated to authentication

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37536].
  {panel}

# use the REST API to update an issue (use /rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey\})
# BUG the response is 204 and the issue is updated correctly
# expected - the response is 200 and the issue is updated correctly

As per https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#d2e1698 200 is expected, not 204.
Probably this should be fixed on master not on stable to be kind to any developers using a workaround that looks for 204 instead of 200.
fields.summary: REST API returns 204 instead of 200 on successful issue update

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37535].
  {panel}

It would be very helpful to me if the JIRA REST api included a method for creating new projects (which included the ability to set all attributes for the project).

Right now only option I can see for scripted creating of projects via an api appears to be the Soap api which only has a limited createProject function that doesn't allow some project attributes to be set;
Namely as far I can see it's lacking the ability to set:
* category for the project
* issue type scheme for the project
* notification email (the email address used in the from field of notification emails)
* screen scheme
* workflow scheme
* field scheme
So projects created via it still have to be updated by hand to set the remaining attributes.   (which means we can't automate our project creation workflow fully)
fields.summary: REST api method for creating a project (including setting all project attributes)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37531].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce : Issues -> Search for Issues -> 'Project Name' filter.

When we click on the 'project name' filter under 'search issues' option, we get to see only portion of the project name; full name of project is not displayed.
Screenshot is attached for reference.
It would be helpful if the full project name is displayed; as in some cases, different projects have initial part of the name similar and last word in the project name changes.

Workaround :
Switch to advanced mode on issue navigator.
fields.summary: Project name display on issue navigator
Jira API error.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37529].
  {panel}

Users are blocked out after being added to the atlassian-addons group.  

This group is not meant to grant any permissions, and is intended for use only with Atlassian Connect.  Installing an Atlassian Connect add-on creates a user, who is added to this group automatically.  This user's permissions, together with the scopes white list determine which API calls an add-on can make. 

Users should not be able to add anyone to this group, and right now it's completely blocking people from logging in if they are added.

*Workaround:* Remove users from the atlassian-addons group.
fields.summary: Users receive "Invalid Credentials" when added to atlassian-addons group
Smarter behaviour for suggestions on fields containing multiple words
Store the history of user from lastViewed into database

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37521].
  {panel}

*Resolution*
* JIRA now uses the extension of the file to determine if it is a zip, instead of opening and inspecting the top of the file.
* If it is a zip, the description of the entries is cached so the zip doesn't need to be opened again.

---
Steps to reproduce:

# Create an issue and reload it a few times; observe the page load times on average.
# Create a zip file with about 10 files at the root.
# Attatch it to an issue 10-20 times.
# Refresh the issue and now observe the average page load times.

The problem is that the jira-view-issue-plugin extracts every single Zip File attached to an issue on every page load. See: jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-view-issue-plugin/src/main/resources/viewissue/attachmentsblock.vm

This should be turned into an asynchronous operation so that, only when a user clicks on the drop-down arrow for that attachment do we fire a rest call and get the data, performing the extraction in that operation.

In the long term we should even consider Connecting that location for Cloud so that we can pull zip file extraction out into a shared service.
fields.summary: Browsing an Issue is very slow on a page with many Zip Attachments and Zip Support enabled.
Add cloning as a bulk operation
As an user, I'd like to include LaTex style math symbols in comments
Don't let default be all issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37517].
  {panel}

There are times where 1) either the workflow designer forgot to put in a transition for an end state to allow the user to take it back to an initial state (e.g. Reopen) or 2) The process changes where you need to allow for a transition from an end state that may no longer be the end state.

Currently, you cannot do this without much hassle.  You have to copy the old one so that it is inactive, add your states and transitions.  

Then, create a new workflow scheme to where you associate this new workflow to the appropriate issue types. 

Then change the workflow scheme.

There is no option to just switch out an existing workflow with a new one for an issue type since when you remove it, you have to indicate what to migrate issues to that typically go to your unassigned issues - if you do that, we would lost all valid states.  Thus, you have to switch out the entire workflow scheme. 

In this same light, if a status is no longer be referenced in a workflow, can you please allow us to delete it.  Again, you have to follow the same process as above as you can only delete through the copy, create the new scheme, and apply the new scheme.  Again, as process changes, workflows will too and I want to keep the workflow as clean as possible and not have these random statuses in it that are not being uses.
fields.summary: Allow adding transitions to an end status as well as delete status no longer in use

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37516].
  {panel}

I want to be able to have a "Team" dashboard that any person can use and it shows them the tickets that are for the team that person is part of. It is similar to how the function currentUser() works in filters to apply to gadgets in the dashboard.
So instead of doing a filter that looks like this & each team manager having to create a copy & a copy of the dashboard:
project = TT AND Categories not in (Project) AND (assignee in membersOf(OPERATIONS_SRE) OR "Assignee group" = OPERATIONS_SRE AND assignee is EMPTY) ORDER BY priority DESC, duedate ASC
I want to be able to do this for one dashboard that every manager can use for "their team":
project = TT AND Categories not in (Project) AND (assignee in membersOf(currentUsersTeam()) OR "Assignee group" = currentUsersTeam() AND assignee is EMPTY) ORDER BY priority DESC, duedate ASC

Ps.: This functionality probable require a definition of a new entity on the user model: "user team". The list of "user teams" differ from the list of user groups because the last one include all the login groups.

Similar discussion: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/251082/filter-to-pick-up-requests-for-all-users-in-current-group-dynamic-passing-of-group-name
fields.summary: Team Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37513].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

When the user creates a project in JIRA, there user has a lot of options to choose between different project templates. After the project is created, you will have to manually modify the workflows, issue types, etc. involved in the project, as there is no option to modify the whole project template.

h3. Expected behaviour

We want the possibility of modifying the project template as an "Edit" option, so we don't have to associate all the changes involved in the template. This should also allow for applying project templates to previously created projects that were not created with a new template.
fields.summary: Change project template after project was created

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37507].
  {panel}

Clicking on the *Issue* tab in the JIRA toolbar, will list the filters. If user has a lot of filters (more than 10 saved filters) and has the screen resolution at 1280x720, users will encounter the issue.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Screen Resolution to 1280 x 720
#* We support a minimum of 1024 x 768 as mentioned in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms
# Create 10-15 saved filters
# Click on the Issues tab

h4. Expected
The filter list should be automatically scrollable

h4. Actuality
It tries to list all the filters as seen in the attached screenshots
!Chrome_1280x720.png!

h4. Workaround
You can configure to show certain number of dropdown issue history and issue filter  for the "View Issue" tab by doing the following
# Shutdown JIRA
# Edit {{jira-config.properties}} located in $JIRA_HOME to add the following (Create one if there is none yet)
{noformat}     jira.max.issue.filter.dropdown.items  = 5
     jira.max.issue.history.dropdown.items = 3{noformat}
# Save and restart JIRA
fields.summary: Issue Tab Dropdown Menu Filter Should be Scrollable
